newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila shares ends down despite last-minute buying.
newsitem.headline: Manila shares ends down despite last-minute buying.

text.p: A late-session bout of buying failed to prop up the Manila stock index which drifted in negative territory in sluggish trade on Tuesday, brokers said.
Ana Candelaria, investment analyst of Eastern Securities Development Corp, said most foreign funds have diverted their attention to other bourses in the region.
"Locals are mostly in a wait-and-see mode," she said.

"Some people are getting impatient," Allan Tuazon, assistant manager for research at Urbancorp Securities Inc, said, citing the early selldown which brought the index to its intra-day low of 3,054.51.
However, Tuazon said some foreign funds began picking up selected stocks which have reached their bottoms by late session. "Foreign funds are waiting in the wings," he said.
The composite index fell 19.22 points, or 0.62 percent, on Tuesday to close at 3,073.12.
